definition: lit. to kill the tiger and behead the scaly dragon
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
a legendary dragon with the ability to control rain and floods/see also 蛟龍|蛟龙[jiao1 long2]
to beg while playing the xiao 箫 (mouth organ)/cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥, destitute refugee from Chu 楚, busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician
lit. to burn both fragrant orchids and stinking weeds (idiom); fig. to destroy indiscriminately the noble and common/the rain falls on the just and unjust alike
wild and disorderly
tyrant and oppressor of the people (idiom); traitorous dictator
the morning dew will swiftly dissipate (idiom); fig. ephemeral and precarious nature of human existence
list of emperors and kings/dynastic genealogy
usurper
wicker door, hole window (idiom); fig. wretched hovel/living in poverty
malpractice/abuse/corrupt practice
(cf Book of Songs) How to fashion an ax handle? You need an ax/fig. to follow a principle/fig. to act as matchmaker
to revere the master and his teaching
to whip and insult
Men of Zheng fighting over their respective ages (idiom)/a futile quarrel
to stop eating and spit out
to cling to the rich and powerful (idiom); to advance one's career by currying favor/social climbing
outstanding talent
